Flock of Birds configuration steps:

  1. Set the serial port to which the Flock of Birds is connected.
  2. Set the baud for the serial port.
  3. Set the hemisphere of the transmitter within which the user(s) will be operating.
  4. Set the Fast Bird Bus (FBB) address of the master bird. This is determined by the DIP switch settings on the birds. With EPROM version 3.67 or newer, this value will be detected automatically by the device driver. Otherwise, it must be set correctly here.
  5. Set the addressing mode. This will depend on the type of Flock hardware being used. With EPROM verrsion 3.67 or newer, this value will be detected automatically by the device driver. Otherwise, it must be set correctly here.
  6. Set the filter. This value is currently ignored by the device driver.
  7. Set the physical units of the data returned by the sensors. Currently, the Flock of Birds tracking system only returns inches, but the device driver always reinterprets this as Feet. Therefore, Feet must be chosen.
  8. Configure the position and orientation of the MotionStar Wireless transmitter (the large black box) relative to the VR Juggler coordinate frame. This process configures what is known as a "position transform filter." The panels titled "Orientation" and "Position" present an easy way to perform this task.
